name: French Quarter Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the French Quarter Inn before and after our family Christmas vacation on the Isle of Palms. Both times we were blown away by the service. The ladies at the front desk were so welcoming, and Steve and the front door was a wonderful help. They give a glass of champagne when you check in, have wine and cheese tastings and cookies and milk every evening. It is within walking distance to shopping, the historical sites, and night life. We dined at Tristan in the lobby with our 8 month old and also had a wonderful experience. The food and service were both outstanding! Definately at the top of our meals in the area. We were told to stay at the Charleston Place, but are so thankful we went with our instinct and chose FQI!
reviews.title: Can I give it a 6?!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: French Quarter was a superb stay. We couldn't believe the size of the standard King room, with vesibule, large bathroom, large bedroom and large alcove complete with computer and fax machine for surfing the internet and at no extra charge!
reviews.title: Right in the Heart of Charleston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and accommodating. We loved the coffee and tea setup on our floor. Cookies are served 8:30 in the evening and a continental breakfast is served each morning on the first level.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel With Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is not cheap, but if you can afford it, it's well worth the price. We booked through Expedia at 232 tax inclusive. One surprise is the 17.00 valet parking fee, plus tips.
reviews.title: Just a wonderful hotel with amazing amenities and superb location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the French Quarter Inn for two night in December, 2009. The hotel is in the middle of everything so we walked everwhere. The staff was so nice and accomodating. We asked them to help us with carriage rides, ghost tours and directions and they were extremely nice and professional. We loved the wine & cheese served in the lobby. The valets were also very nice and helpful. They also gave us great suggestions on which homes and plantations to tour. We got a great suite with a fireplace and balcony and it was very inexpensive. We will definately stay at the French Quarter Inn when in Charleston again.
reviews.title: Nice splurge hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: What a great stay I just had at the French Quarter Inn. The room was great (super clean) and had all the amenities. The mattress and pillows were a perfect end to busy days walking the gorgeous streets of Charleston. The continental breakfast was great, and so was the wine and cheese in the lobby each evening. And, the Inn houses an INCREDIBLE restaurant - Tristan's - don't miss it.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We read the reviews and booked the French Quarter Inn. WOW! So nice! Pleasant helpful staff, nice continental breakfast, service with a smile. Everything exceded our expectations. If that isn't enough, the location puts you walking distance to everything you want to see.
reviews.title: The reviewers are right- it's awesome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I can't say enough about how much I liked this hotel! Located in the historic district of the city, great food and open air markets were just nextdoor! The rooms were oh-so nice, and no detail was ignored. Early evening wine tasting gave me a chance to catch up with my travel companions, and none of us were limited to trying just one or two wines :) I don't think one can fully experience Charleston without staying at a hotel like this!
reviews.title: Nicest Hotel of all!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the French Quarter Inn for three nights in January. From the time we entered the hotel, we were so well treated. Our bellman, Matthew, was exceptionally welcoming and helpful as was the personnel at the check-in desk and everyone else we met who worked there. Our room was very comfortable and elegant but not overdone. Nice, spacious bathroom. Really comfortable beds. The area is quiet so it was easy sleeping even though the Inn is in a convenient location for walking around Charleston.
reviews.title: Outstanding stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is very nice as well. Even though I usually abhor "swarm-style" breakfasts, this one was quite pleasant with excellent pastries, fruit and enough to get us started on the day. The tables are scattered through the reception area so it has more of a cafe feeling. Wine and cheese are also served there in the afternoon.
reviews.title: Our Favorite Place in Charleston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything about this hotel is lovely--including the inviting exterior. We thoroughly enjoyed our hotel experience and felt that it made our Charleston trip perfect. The stunning lobby with fireplace and circular staircase, the wine and cheese reception, the beautiful pastries with the continental breakfast--and more!--all made our stay special--so much better than a large hotel would offer. The location puts everything--including many, many fine restaurants--within a short walking distance. The place is a jewel! We will return.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here on 2 separate occasions in November and will definitely return on our next visit to USA. This hotel is all that it promises and more. From our arrival and the welcome of the valet staff to all the other facilities and ameniteis this hotel was the tops and the location is really good for the historic quarter of Charleston with everything within walking distance or pedi-cycle.
reviews.title: An amazing find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The quality of the room, the food, the facilities were excellent and the staff were friendly, helpful and very attentive. After or first stay here all other hotels had a very hard act to follow.
reviews.title: The BEST: Elegance, warmth, style and service in Downtown Charleston!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Fabulous by every criteria! You are treated with gracious and indulgent care from the moment you drive up until the moment you leave in this charmingly elegant and fashionable top-of-its-class boutique hotel. We were welcomed by each and every staff member from the informative and helpful doorman/bellhop, Michael, to the world-class general manager, Bernard Visscher. Marvin at Reception was there to assist in every way, as were many others. We are a seasoned, retired traveling couple who stay in 3 - 5 star hotels and resorts regularly. Charleston's French Quarter Inn has instantly become one of our favorite destinations. How can you resist being handed a welcome glass of champagne and butterfingers at reception? We were encouraged to sit in front of their working fireplace (a gas charmer, without wood or smoke) on soft, elegant living room chairs and relax while our belongings were being taken up to our room and our car parked. There is a reasonable charge for private parking, but in downtown Charleston this is expected. Coffee and tea are always available in the hotel's delightful lobby where you take in the view of their magnificent spiral staircase, open to a glass ceiling; all very dramatic. Return later for wine, cheese and fruit served daily late afternoons. Cookies in the evening. Mornings begin with a substantial continental breakfast with long hours. And have we mentioned the room? Perfect. Large, immaculate, bright, elegantly comfortable. We enjoyed talking to the staff in general and especially to the General Manager, Bernard Visscher, who is most welcoming and entertaining as he told us of his early days growing up in The Netherlands and traveling to many countries as he worked his way up the corporate hotel ladder. He speaks five languages and can regale you with many international tales. Best of all, he likes people and his brand of warmth, elegance and hospitality is reflected in all that is the French Quarter Inn. No, we do not own stock in the hotel. We simply arrived with hopes and left with smiles.
reviews.title: Fantastic, as usual

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: I travel to Charleston for business at least 10 times a year. Ever since finding the French Quarter Inn, it always my first choice of a hotel. The location is convenient to everything. They provide so many more amenities than most hotels, from the continental breakfast in the morning, to the wine and cheese reception each evening, to the milk and cookies at night. As a female traveling alone, I always feel safe and secure while at the French Quarter Inn. The service is consistently outstanding. I highly recommend the French Quarter.
reviews.title: The Reviews Aren't Wrong... FANTASTIC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first visit to Charleston. I did a Priceline "name your price", and ended up here at a great price! The service here is top notch. They are very accommodating, from the champagne and lady fingers, to the pillow menu! The continental breakfast was perfectly fine (although nothing extraordinary). The room was large and comfortable and the location very good.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, great service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: reviews looked great and the location and hotel size was right..very friendly staff and a competitive rate for this level of hotel in that spot of town. We didn't eat at the restaurant Tristan, but enjoyed a cocktail nightly at the bar..very nice martini. the room was large and quiet. we had coffee and tea on the floor. yes we were greeted with champagne had sampled the wine and cheese in the early evening. nice touches. bedding was great and bathroom updated enough. a common outdoor balcony for a view or smoke. breakfast was simple and just right to save room to enjoy the local food scene. valet parking 17 per day. i had a coupon for one day free parking. when i presented to the front they took it and corrected my bill but seemed a bit inconvenienced. i don't know..probably should have presented coupon upon check in. stayed three nights, we got turn down on two of those.
reviews.title: classy spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: would stay there again. the coffee should be stronger (saw the staff bringing in starbucks for themselves..hmm) and will try the restaurant next time.
reviews.title: A true service leader with great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: First, if you want to be in the heart of the Market and Port area of Charleston, this is the place to stay. The Market is steps from the hotel and you can see the waterway, cruise ships from the hotel balconies or one in your room.
reviews.title: Lives up to reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012
reviews.text: Second, other hotels need to follow the service standards from the French Quarter Inn. Coffee and teas on each floor in the mornings and easy to get; a delicious continential breakfast (complimentary) in the lobby. Wines, fruits and cheese in the afternoon for a social hour and milk/cookies at night. And, champagne at check in.
reviews.title: Absolutely charming hotel and amenities like no other!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading the reviews on here, I booked this hotel because everyone raved about it. For good reason. I've never seen such service in a hotel, and I mean better than a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons. We were upgraded to a suite, I'm not sure why, that had a fireplace in the living room and a balcony. There was a small bottle of champagne in the fridge and chocolates on the table. They have a complimentary wine and cheese party every night, and the breakfast (that is also included) in the lobby is delicious. We felt very spoiled here, the people were so nice and friendly, and I want to go back! There is only one thing I can complain about. The mattress was old and sagging in the middle. I mentioned this to the front desk, and they said that they were replacing all of the mattresses in March.
reviews.title: My new favorite hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I spent three wonderful nights at the French Quater Inn with a group of women. The service was impeccable and everyone there was so helpful and polite. The room was delightful with a added bonus of a pillow menu. The mattress on the bed was delightful. The complimentary breakfast in the morning and the complimentary evening snacks was a wonderful touch to a great experience. Would highly recommend the French Quarter Inn. It is also connected to one of the best restaurants in Charlston, Tristans.
reviews.title: French Quarter Inn a wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Just returned from a 5-day business "retreat" with a group of 26 people. Every single one of them raved about this hotel -- from beautiful, comfortable rooms to special amenities such as cheese and crackers at 5:00 p.m. and cookies and milk at bedtime. No detail was overlooked. Wifi worked flawlessly no matter where we were in the hotel, and staff was friendly and helpful on every level. Would book here again in a heartbeat. Thanks, FQI, for a great experience in your beautiful city!
reviews.title: Great hotel and amenites like no other!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent one in Charleston for our anniversary and are so happy we stayed at the French Quarter Inn. We really enjoyed the champagne and lady fingers upon arrival and the wine happy hour. We were given the suggestion of Amen Street with a free appetizer from the front desk, great idea...loved it for lunch. We ate at McCrady's for dinner and it was fabulous. The only some what negative was the breakfast was very average in my opinion, I knew it was continental but the fruit was not fresh, almost looked canned or like it had been used again from a previous day...just a very minor disappointment. I would recommend to stay here, lovely hotel. Another things I should mention, they had champagne waiting for us in our room when we arrived...very nice touch as well. Looking forward to staying again.
reviews.title: Great Anniversary Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Charleston is a beautiful city and the FQI is the icing on the cake. We had 8 travelers in our group and the staff, front desk, room service and the night staff could not have made us feel more at home or welcomed. Thanks to Jenny, Marvin, Karen, Taylor and many more. (How often do you stay at a hotel and end up knowing the staff's name? That is the kind of personal service the FQI is all about.)
reviews.title: Icing on the Charleston Cake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Gym? No.
reviews.title: No Amenities, Overpriced & Dishonest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Pool? No.
reviews.title: Absolutely the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pets? No.
reviews.title: Absolutely love this property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Healthy breakfast? No.
reviews.title: Perfect location and wonderful amenities!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room service? Not until the inexplicable hour of 6 p.m.
reviews.title: Pampering, quiet and comfortable in the heart of Old Charleston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We just spent six of the most glorious nights at the French Quarter Inn. As a Christmas gift to our grown children we booked three rooms at FQI. From the moment we were greeted by the valet staff to the last goodbye we were treated like "the only guests in the house." By the end of the first night, the staff new our names and always called us by name whenever they saw us in the hotel.
reviews.title: You Can't Say Enough!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The champagne at check in is delightful. Every amenity is top notch. The hotel and its staff scrimps on nothing. Every request is met with a resolution, a recommendation, or whatever it takes to make you happy.
reviews.title: A true Southern Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One room of our party had to leave for a night. The hotel allowed them to check out and check back in the following day rather than charge us for the empty room.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location was the best in town. Even though we had an automobile, we seldom used it as everything we wanted was within walking distance.
reviews.title: Wonderful - will stay again!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It would be hard to single out one person; however, Jenny at the front desk was always willing to go above and beyond to make sure we had a good time. Marvin's dining recommendations were without a doubt fantastic. If he recommends it, it's worth going. He didn't steer us wrong the entire trip.
reviews.title: The BEST in Charleston! Excellence, Style, Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I reserved rooms at this hotel on the basis of its extremely good reputation on Tripadvisor. It is a good hotel, but we did not find it exceptional. It is true that the hotel is very well located in the historic area, close to all the attractions. The staff were professional and helpful. There are very nice touches like wine and cheese at 5 pm, milk and cookies later, and the fact that continental breakfast is included in the rate (which was about $180 per night). But our room (211) was located at one end of the hotel near some kind of utilities room and there was a loud engine whirring, which was particularly noticeable at bed time. We could also hear voices from the adjoining room on the other side. The hallways are very brightly lit at night and light showed though the cracks around the door when we turned the lights off. So our sleep was interrupted. Also, I found the decor a little garish, particularly the carpet in the public areas. On the whole, the hotel was good, but the noise was a real issue for us, and having now seen some of the beautiful B & Bs in the area, I doubt whether we would choose the FQI again.
reviews.title: Good hotel but some issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel in the historic district therefore easy walking distance to everything inCharleston. The continental breakfast which is included, will even be delivered to your room at no additional cost! The entire staff were very friendly and most helpful..just great southern hospitality all the time.
reviews.title: Modern day Southern Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to have a weekend away in Charleston and stayed at the French Quarter Inn. Check in was great - staff were super friendly and we were greeted with a glass of champagne. Our room was beautiful!! Fireplace, wonderful view, and comfy bed. There was a pillow menu! There is a wine and cheese reception every evening. There is hot tea and coffee on each floor 24/7. The valet guys knew who we were without giving them a ticket or even having to say a word. Oh, and LOCATION! It overlooks the market. You can't ask for a better location! The only small complaint I have is that the breakfast leaves a little to be desired. We had an awesome stay and we will be back!!
reviews.title: Awesome!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is the embodiment of hospitality and charm, from the champagne and lady fingers at check-in, to the evening wine and cheese and the night-time cookies and milk, this hotel strives to make you feel welcome. The "continental breakfast" is so much more than what you would expect from other places. It was too bad we didn't have time to stay longer.
reviews.title: Excellent Hospitality!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Wonderful service, great staff, and much appreciated amenities. In the afternoon they have free cheese and wine in the lounge and evening fresh baked cookies....it's not that I even wanted them, but it's awesome that they offer!
reviews.title: They have free wine and cheese AND cookies!

description: The AAA Four Diamond Inn’s newly redesigned rooms are inspired by the old world elegance of a Parisian chateau set against the architectural backdrop of Charleston’s classic French Quarter. Red medallion-patterned draperies and damask chenille upholstery in hues of black, white and gold create a rich distinction between the fabrics and furniture, of the highest quality.Among many other amenities, guests of the hotel enjoy complimentary items such as: champagne and lady fingers at check-in, an evening wine and cheese reception, freshly baked cookies and milk, evening turn down service and gourmet continental breakfast in the lobby or served to your room. The over-sized guest rooms, some with working fireplaces, private balconies, and whirlpool tubs, provide imagery of an era gone by, but still grants contemporary amenities a sophisticated traveler has come to expect.Enjoy some of Charleston's finest cuisine at Tristan which graces French Quarter Inn's lobby atrium on the ground floor. Chef Nate Whiting prepares unexpected cuisine with traditional ingredients at this chic and stylish AAA Four Diamond restaurant.
